ANDS-Grants.description: Schistosomiasis is a major public health problem in the Philippines with approximately 6.7 million people at risk of infection. Mass human chemotherapy has formed the cornerstone of control for decades but has failed to control the disease. Transmission reduction is a key step towards elimination and integrated interventions should target both definitive and intermediate host transmission pathways. We propose to trial integrated control strategies for the disease and expect the outcomes to have broader implications for Southeast Asia.
ANDS-Grants.title: Schistosomiasis elimination in the Philippines
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council

ANDS-Grants.description: Schistosomiasis is a major public health problem in the Philippines with approximately 6.7 million people at risk of infection. Mass human chemotherapy has formed the cornerstone of control for decades but has failed to control the disease. Transmission reduction is a key step towards elimination and integrated interventions should target both definitive and intermediate host transmission pathways. We propose to trial integrated control strategies for the disease and expect the outcomes to have broader implications for Southeast Asia.
ANDS-Grants.title: Towards sustainable control and elimination of schistosomiasis in the Philippines
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council

ANDS-Grants.description: We will undertake an intervention trial to assess the effectiveness of the “BALatrine” (a novel latrine) and hygiene education in the prevention of intestinal worms in Indonesia. This will provide an evidence base for translation of the intervention into public health policy and practice in Indonesia, the Asian region and beyond.
ANDS-Grants.title: The effectiveness, acceptability and cost effectiveness of the 'BALatrine'
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council
